meanings.definition: Maquilas: factories in Mexico where imported materials are assembled and exported
meanings.sent1: The maquilas in Mexico create many jobs for people.
meanings.sent2: We learned about maquilas in our geography class.
meanings.sent3: The maquilas in Mexico must be very busy with all the work they do.
meanings.sent4: The maquilas hum with activity like a beehive.
meanings.sent5: The maquilas stand tall against the horizon, symbols of industry.

meanings.definition: Maquilas: the process of manufacturing goods in these factories
meanings.sent1: The maquilas involve assembling parts to make products.
meanings.sent2: Global companies often use maquilas to save on production costs.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if the maquilas have a secret recipe for making things so efficiently.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, the maquilas are the heartbeat of production.
meanings.sent5: The maquilas work tirelessly day and night to churn out goods.

meanings.definition: Maquilas: the products produced in these factories
meanings.sent1: The maquilas export a variety of items to different countries.
meanings.sent2: Consumers enjoy the affordable goods made in maquilas.
meanings.sent3: I received a package full of maquilas from my friend in Mexico.
meanings.sent4: The maquilas' products flood the market with quality goods.
meanings.sent5: The shelves in the store are stocked with maquilas from across the border.
